skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: You don't become the Golden Knight if you aren't the most true-hearted warrior in the land, who would die a thousand times to save Kislev from its most-hated enemies.
Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
Taller than many men, armed and armoured to the teeth and beyond – the Golden Knight is a beacon of courage on the battlefield; an example to all Kislevites and the bane of their foes.
When Naryska Leysa's noble father died in battle at Boris Ursus' side, there was only one real choice to be his replacement and become the new Golden Knight.
Though many have tried, none have yet broken through Naryska's steely resolve or bested her in single combat, such is her martial skill.
Naryska is the daughter of the previous Golden Knight, whose valorous blood clearly flows through her veins and guides her noble actions against the Motherland's foes.
The Golden Knight impresses potential allies just as much as she inspires its rank-and-file troops, making them more willing to join with Kislev for their mutual advantage and gain.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +30% for alliances with Kislev
Diplomatic relations: +20 with all Kislev factions

skillTree.localised_description: "For the sake of the Motherland, the Tzarina and for Ursun himself, we must face down this scourge that threatens our very being."

effects.description: Ice Court Support gained: +1 per turn

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases as the unit takes damage

skillTree.localised_description: The Golden Knight may be the champion of Tzarina Katarin, but she is also sworn to defend all Kislev from those who dare invade its hallowed borders.
It's not just warriors bearing steel that Naryska will best – spellcasters and Daemons also find their weapons blunted against her golden carapace, and that of the Lord under her protection.
Unusually, Naryska fights with the blessings of both the Great Orthodoxy and the Ice Court, uniting two ancient institutions, so often at odds, in a single, glorious purpose.
Whomsoever is leading Kislev's armies on the day of battle, be it the Tzarina herself or one of her loyal generals, the Golden Knight will guard them with her life.
No Kislevite warrior trains longer or harder than Naryska Leysa, for even the best among them cannot match her levels of determination and sheer stubborn pride.
For her life, she will give her own ten thousand times over.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

skillTree.localised_description: She does not fight for Tzarina Katarin alone, but the Motherland as a whole, for if it fell to invaders from without, the Golden Knight would have no further purpose in life.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: When Katarin goes to war, all Kislev mobilises to ensure her victory, and her greatest living warrior is always first amongst them.

effects.description:
Speed: +5% for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although she has no equals among the Ice Guard, their fighting prowess improves when in Naryska's presence, as the warrior-women seek to impress her with their own bravery and martial skill.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Ice Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Ice Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Hero's army)

Weapon strength: +15% for Ice Guard units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who fight alongside the Golden Knight inevitably find that the extensive experience she has gained in battle, fighting Kislev's enemies to a bloody death, rubs off on them too.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain: +12% for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Unit experience gain: +25% for Tzar Guard and Ice Guard units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The men and women who have fought with the Golden Knight and proved their mettle are rewarded with fine ceremonial armour plates as a mark of their achievements.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Tzar Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Armour: +20 for Tzar Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Acolytes of Ursun and Tzar Guard units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every member of the armies with whom the Golden Knight serves becomes that little bit tougher and more resilient, as bonds of blood and honour are formed through shared experience.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for all units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 5%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 2
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 4
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 6

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 15% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 30% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: Intrinsically unnatural, yet supernaturally powerful, this artefact exudes an aura that enfeebles the spirit of those who defy its invigorated bearer.

effects.description:
Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

items.colour_text: From the Golden Knight’s resplendent armour hang trinkets bestowed by the High Patriarch, granting legitimacy in the eyes of both the Church and the State.
The magic of Kislev’s first Khan Queen allows the paragon of Kislev to wield this great glacier-cut sabre seemingly crafted for the hand of a giant!

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Consecrated by the Cult of Ursun to be the Tzarina's noble guardian, the Golden Knight walks the near-invisible line between church and state.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with all Kislev factions

Recruit rank: +2 for Tzar Guard units
	(Hero's army)
